title: Google Q2: Peak Dollar Strength And TAC
text: Alphabet stock price rose about 4% in pre-market trading on Wednesday after reporting Q2 earnings the day before. Revenues grew to $69.69B, narrowly missing consensus estimates but still representing a 12.6% YoY growth.

title: Google: Q2 Earnings A Bump On The Road To Success
text: Alphabet is the backbone of the Internet and dominates the advertising market, along with Meta. Google generated lower-than-expected earnings for the second quarter of 2022, due to currency headwinds and a very strong prior quarter.

title: Alphabet Stock Brushes Off Earnings, Revenue Miss
text: Google parent Alphabet Inc (NASDAQ:GOOGL) was last seen 7% higher at $112.38, brushing off top- and bottom-line misses for the second quarter.

title: Google: The Market Is Wrong
text: Google's advertising business is showing robust growth despite a feared slowdown in the ad market. Google's Cloud business is also growing strongly, now has a 9% revenue share.

text: "Alphabet shows digital ad business not falling off a cliff and relatively stable with some soft spots," Wedbush analyst Dan Ives said."

title: Google Is A Buy Despite Disappointing Quarterly Results
text: This quarter's less-than-stellar results are not yet a threat to Alphabet's valuation. The cloud continues to grow strong and will be Alphabet's fortune.

title: Google Buys Chicago Government Building For $105 Million–Bucking Trend Of Major Companies Leaving Illinois
text: Google's Chicago investment comes shortly after three of Illinois' largest companies—Boeing, Caterpillar and Citadel—all moved their headquarters away from the state.

title: 2 Types of Tech Stocks to Buy After Google and Microsoft Save the Market

title: Google parent Alphabet buying massive downtown Chicago building from state of Illinois
text: Google parent Alphabet GOOG, +5.52% GOOGL, +5.58% has struck a deal to acquire the former State of Illinois Building, called the James R. Thompson Center since 1993, for $105 million.

title: GOOG Stock Pops as Alphabet Earnings Report Shows Strong Ad Revenue
text: Source: IgorGolovniov / Shutterstock.com Alphabet (NASDAQ: GOOG , GOOGL ) stock is on the rise Wednesday as investors react to the tech giant's earnings report for the second quarter of 2022. The big news from that earnings report is Google advertising revenue of $56.29 million.

title: Google's Post-Earnings Rally Signals The Bottom Is In
text: Google reported a revenue and earnings miss for Q2, underscoring its vulnerability to broad-based macro challenges. Yet, the stock rallied 5% in post-earnings late-trading. Continued growth observed across all core segments imply Google's long-term growth trajectory remains intact. The worst-case scenario previously priced into the stock is likely being adjusted upwards for better-than-expected ad-sales.

title: Alphabet And Microsoft Missed Their Earnings Estimates
text: Alphabet and Microsoft released their earnings reports Tuesday after the bell, and both tech giants missed estimates.

title: Google shares rise as search delivers resiliency in tough macro environment
text: Google parent Alphabet Inc. reported its second straight earnings decline on Tuesday, although analysts see the company's search business as a major positive in a tough macro environment.

title: Google: My Only Mega-Tech Strong Buy
text: Alphabet reported Q2 earnings yesterday, and despite top- and bottom-line misses, it's the only mega-tech stock my quant ratings rank a Strong Buy. Mega-Tech stocks dominate market performance, with Alphabet responsible for nearly 7% of the Nasdaq 100 weighting.

title: Google Isn't Snap: Why It's Heading Much Higher
text: Google's numbers missed estimates, but the report was good enough to soothe fears. Google's search business illustrates remarkable resilience and should continue to increase growth in future years.

title: Russia has hit Google with more than $380 million in fines this month
text: Google is one of the few US tech companies still operating a service in Russia. The country blocked Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter.

title: Microsoft, Alphabet earnings lift futures ahead of Fed decision
